attributes.action: Ban plastic straws in the UK to save our waterways and environment
attributes.additional_details:
Most straws end up in the ocean where they cause a lot of damage to animals by being mistakenly ingested. Since the 1950s it is estimated by the University of California, Santa Barbara, and the University of Georgia that just 9% of the 9.1 billion tonnes of plastic produced has been recycled.

We need to reduce our reliance on single use plastic and find biodegradable and sustainable alternatives, such as paper straws.
attributes.background: Plastic straws are wreaking havoc across the world. Each straw has a lifespan of just 20 minutes, but it;s estimated it can take up to 400 years to completely break down. The UK uses approximately 8.5 billion straws a year, so lets make a positive change and get rid of them once and for all!
